message:
[`await` by default will capture its context and resume on that context](https://blog.stephencleary.com/2012/02/async-and-await.html). Since this is a UI event handler, the UI framework should supply a context that will cause the `textBox1.Text` line to run on the UI thread.

There are a few obscure scenarios where the UI framework fails to provide that context, e.g., .NET plugins for Microsoft Office. If you're not seeing `await` resume on the UI thread, then I recommend developing a minimal, reproducible example and posting it to Stack Overflow.
